title: Bruins’ Patrice Bergeron was not happy about Jets’ Alexander Burmistrov’s illegal head shot
text: By Chris Greenberg Boston.com Staff | 10.09.15 | 10:35 AM Bruins center Patrice Bergeron doesn’t need a reminder of the risks of head injuries facing NHL players. But he still got one in the team’s opening game of the 2015-2016 season. Bergeron was the recipient of an illegal elbow to the head from Winnipeg Jets center Alexander Burmistrov late in the first period on Thursday night at TD Garden. “It was a hit to the head. Even though he apologized after, it’s one of those that I didn’t have the puck at that time,” Bergeron said after the game, via WEEI.com . “You have to realize where the guy is and his position.” Advertisement - Continue Reading Below — Pete Blackburn (@PeteBlackburn) October 8, 2015 Bergeron’s displeasure with the hit was evident immediately. After collecting himself, he skated after Burmistrov and cross-checked him. When officials halted the ensuing scuffle, Burmistrov was penalized for an illegal check to the head and Bergeron was called for cross-checking. #NHLBruins PP with 36. 2 on the clock. Burmistrov off for illegal check to the head. Lowry off for roughing. Bergeron off for cross-checking — Boston Bruins (@NHLBruins) October 8, 2015 Followng his team’s 6-2 defeat , Bruins head coach Claude Julien told reporters he believes that Burmistrov should face additional punishment from the NHL. “It will be interesting to see how that is reviewed,” said Julien, via CSNNE.com . “Especially when it’s to an elite player in the league that’s had some [concussion] issues in the past. I hope [the Department of Player Safety] looks at it seriously, and in my mind I don’t know why there wouldn’t be further consequences to that.” Meet the Bruins’ newcomers: Previous -- of -- Next During the 2015 offseason, the Bruins signed Matt Beleskey as a free agent out of Anaheim for $19-million and five years. With the Ducks last season, the seven-year veteran winger had 22 goals and 10 assists in 65 games. He added eight goals in the playoffs. Winslow Townson/AP The Bruins signed five-year veteran Jimmy Hayes to a three-year, $6.9 million deal. In 72 games with the Florida Panthers last season, the 6-5 right wing had 19 goals and 16 assists. Winslow Townson/AP Previous -- of -- Next The Bruins signed Brett Connolly to a one-year, $1 million deal. In 50 games with the Tampa Bay Lightning last season, the four-year veteran winger scored 12 goals and had three assists. He did play five games for the Bruins last season, recording two assists. Winslow Townson/AP The Bruins signed Matt Irwin to a one-year, $800,000 deal. In 52 games with the San Jose Sharks last season, the three-year veteran defenseman had eight goals and 11 assists with a plus/minus of 3. Winslow Townson/AP The Bruins signed four-year veteran Zac Rinaldo to a two-year, $1.7 million deal. In 58 games with the Philadelphia Flyers, the center scored one goal and recored five assists. He averaged 143 penatly minutes in his four seasons in Philly. Bruce Bennettt/Getty Images
